etymologies: late Middle English: from Old Northern French saussiche, from medieval Latin salsicia, from Latin salsus ‘salted’ (see sauce)

definitions: an item of food in the form of a cylindrical length of minced pork or other meat encased in a skin, typically sold raw to be grilled or fried before eating.
shortDefinitions: length of minced meat encased in skin

definitions: minced and seasoned meat that has been encased in a skin and cooked or preserved, sold mainly to be eaten cold in slices
shortDefinitions: minced and seasoned meat cooked or preserved in cylindrical form

definitions: used in references to the characteristic cylindrical shape of sausages
shortDefinitions: used in references to characteristic cylindrical shape of sausages
